channel.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
channel.itunes:subtitle: Tom Keene, Sara Eisen and Ken Prewitt have the economy and the markets "under surveillance."
channel.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
channel.itunes:summary: Tom Keene, Sara Eisen and Ken Prewitt have the economy and the markets "under surveillance."
channel.description: Tom Keene, Sara Eisen and Ken Prewitt have the economy and the markets "under surveillance." Hosted by Tom Keene, Sara Eisen, Ken Prewitt

item.title: Pimco's Gross Says Bond Market Is Reaching Stability (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Gross Says Bond Market Is Reaching Stability
item.itunes:summary: June 27 (Bloomberg) -- Bill Gross, co-chief investment officer of Pacific Investment Management Co., says the bond market is becoming more stable after two months of low bond yields. Gross talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kroszner Discusses Fed Communication of Future QE (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Kroszner Discusses Fed Communication of Future QE
item.itunes:summary: June 27 (Bloomberg) -- Randall Kroszner, former Federal Reserve Governor and professor at University of Chicago Booth School, discusses the Fed's challenge of communicating the future of quantitative easing to the public. Kroszner talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: G Plus's Komileva Says Years of Volatility to Come (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: G Plus's Komileva Says Years of Volatility to Come
item.itunes:summary:
June 27 (Bloomberg) -- Lena Komileva, managing director and chief economist at G Plus Economics Ltd., says the improvement in the U.S. and global economies is not a sign of a complete recovery from recession. Komileva talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Weinberg Says U.S. Growing Despite Global Volatility (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Weinberg Says U.S. Growing Despite Volatility
item.itunes:summary:
June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Carl Weinberg, founder and chief economist of High Frequency Economics Ltd., says the U.S. economy is growing despite volatility in the global markets. Weinberg talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: HSBC's Chidley Says Gold to Average $1,400 an Ounce (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: HSBC's Chidley Says Gold to Average $1,400 an Ounce
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Patrick Chidley, senior vice president of global metals and mining research at HSBC Securities USA Inc., says gold will average about $1,400 this year. Childley talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." Peter Fisher, senior director at BlackRock Inc., also joins the conversation. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BlackRock's Fisher Discusses Effectiveness of QE Policy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Fisher Discusses Effectiveness of QE Policy
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Fisher, a senior director at the BlackRock Investment Institute, discusses the effect of the Federal Reserve's quantitative easing policy on the economy and financial markets. Fisher talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CRT's Ader Says He Expects Taper to Last Into Mid-2014 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Ader Says He Expects Taper to Last Into Mid-2014
item.itunes:summary:
June 27 (Bloomberg) -- David Ader, head of rates strategy at CRT Capital Group LLC, says the Federal Reserve's taper of asset purchases will be cautious, lasting into next year. Powell talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SportsOneSource's Powell Says Nike to Win With New Tech (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Powell Says Nike to Win With New Tech
item.itunes:summary:
June 27 (Bloomberg) -- Matt Powell, an analyst at SportsOneSource, says Nike's recent push on wearable technology will be very successful. Powell talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Jonas Says Hospitals Benefit From Health-Care Reform (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonas Says Hospitals Benefit From HealthCare Reform
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Jeff Jonas, an analyst at Gabelli & Co. Inc., says hospitals will benefit the most from U.S. health-care reform. Jonas talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Maki Says First Quarter Growth Reflected Lower Spending (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Maki Says First Quarter Reflected Lower Spending
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Dean Maki, chief economist at Barclays Plc, says the U.S. economy grew less than projected in the first quarter of 2013, reflecting a decrease in consumer spending. Maki talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wells Fargo's Mangus Says Economy `Deeper, Broader' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Wells Fargo's Mangus Says Economy `Deeper, Broader'
item.itunes:summary:
June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Paul Mangus, head of equity research and strategy for Wells Fargo Bank NA, says he is very positive about the direction of the U.S. economy. Mangus talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pivotal's Wieser Sees Lower Margins for Google (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Pivotal's Wieser Sees Lower Margins for Google
item.itunes:summary:
June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Brian Wieser, senior research analyst at Pivotal Research Group LLC, says Google's operations strategy will lead to a "significant margin reduction." Wieser talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stern, Igel Discuss Compensation Rights in NCAA (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Stern, Igel Discuss Compensation Rights in NCAA
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Eric Stern, a legal commentator, and Lee Igel, professor of sports management at New York University Tish Center, discuss a lawsuit brought against the NCAA by former players over compensation rights. They speak with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cerberus's Nardelli Says `Corporations Remain Cautious' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Nardelli Says `Corporations Remain Cautious'
item.itunes:summary: June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Bob Nardelli, senior advisor at Cerberus Capital Management LP and former chief executive officer of Home Depot Inc. and Chrysler, says the uncertainty of the U.S regulations, Federal Reserve policy, and President Obama's carbon emission plan causes chief executives to be cautious in planning future business operations. Nardelli talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sharma Says Emerging Market Issues `Much Bigger Story' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sharma Says Emerging Market Issues `Bigger Story'
item.itunes:summary:
June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Ruchir Sharma, managing director at Morgan Stanley Investment Management Inc., says the problems faced by emerging markets are not solely a result of the Federal Reserve's threat of tapering quantitative easing. Sharma talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bob Inglis Says Republicans Too Quiet on Climate Change (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Inglis Says Republicans Too Quiet on Climate Change
item.itunes:summary:
June 26 (Bloomberg) -- Former Rep. Bob Inglis, a Republican from South Carolina, says Republicans are hesitant to speak on climate change because they are unsure about support in their districts. Inglis talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Heymann Says `Manufacturing Is Gradually Improving'(Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Heymann Says `Manufacturing Is Gradually Improving'
item.itunes:summary: June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Nicholas Heymann, analyst of William Blair & Co. LLC, says despite various national and international economic factors, industrial manufacturing will continue to gradually improve in the second half of 2013. Heymann talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Morgan Stanley's Redeker Says U.S. Economy `Too Strong' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Redeker Says U.S. Economy `Too Strong'
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Hans-Guenter Redeker, managing director at Morgan Stanley, says the U.S. economy's growth is outpaces the rest of the world and this could negatively affecting other countries. Redeker talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wellesley's Case Says Housing Prices `Extraordinary' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Case Says Housing Prices `Extraordinary'
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Karl Case, co-founder of Case-Schiller and professor emeritus at Wellesley College, says he is confident in the strengthening U.S. housing market. Case talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Piecyk Says Merger Would Strengthen Sprint, Clearwire (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Piecyk Says Merger To Strengthen Sprint, Clearwire
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Walter Piecyk, an analyst at BTIG LLC, says a proposed merger between Sprint Nextel Corp. and Clearwire Corp. would make them powerful enough to compete with other carriers. Piecyk talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Meyer Says Faith in Market Leads to Rise in Home Prices (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Meyer Says Market Faith Leads to Rising Home Prices
item.itunes:summary: June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Michelle Meyer, senior economist of Bank of America Merrill Lynch, says consumers' restored faith in the housing market will continue to increase home prices throughout 2013. Meyer talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Municipal's Fabian Says `Trading Slows in Muni Market' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Fabian Says `Trading Slows in Muni Market'
item.itunes:summary: June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Matt Fabian, managing director of Municipal Market Advisors, says trading in the municipal bond market is slowing down as investors await better conditions in the third quarter. Fabian talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Routehappy's Albert Says Fliers Want `Happy and Cheap' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Routehappy CEO Says Fliers Want `Happy and Cheap'
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Robert Albert, chief executive officer and founder of Routehappy, says the travel website caters to users who care about on-board amenities. Albert talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: RBC's Wetenhall Says Normal Housing Starts to Return (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Wetenhall Says Normal Housing Starts to Return
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Robert Wetenhall, an analyst at RBC Capital Markets LLC, says housing starts will rise to $1.5 million by 2015. Wetenhall talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Firebrand's Galloway Says `Transparency Hurts the Fed' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Galloway Says `Transparency Hurts the Feds'
item.itunes:summary:
June 25 (Bloomberg) -- Scott Galloway, chairman of Firebrand Partners, says the Federal Reserve may have been too transparent in announcing its plan to taper quantitative easing, as the market begins to lose faith. Galloway talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cross's Williams Says Oracle, Red Hat in Trouble (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Cross's Williams Says Oracle, Red Hat in Trouble
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Richard Williams, analyst at Cross Research, says Oracle and Red Hat Inc. are now reporting a slowdown after hiding their economic troubles throughout the previous quarter. Williams talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pimco's El-Erian Sees Lower Bond Yields by End of 2013 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: El-Erian Sees Lower Bond Yields by End of 2013
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Mohamed El-Erian, chief executive officer of Pacific Investment Management Co., says bond yields will be lower by the end of 2013. El-Erian talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Arthur Levitt Says Dodd-Frank Act `Doesn't Work' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Arthur Levitt Says Dodd-Frank Act `Doesn't Work'
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Arthur Levitt, former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, says he agrees with those who are opposed to the Dodd-Frank Act. Levitt talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bentley's Sumner Says `More Stimulus' For Inflation (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Bentley's Sumner Says `More Stimulus' For Inflation
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Scott Sumner, a professor of economics at Bentley University, says the Federal Reserve should continue its stimulus longer than Chairman Ben Bernanke has indicated in order to reach inflation targets. Sumner talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: McEvoy Says `Interest Rates Will Predict Future Growth' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: McEvoy Says `Interest Rates Will Predict Growth'
item.itunes:summary: June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Terry McEvoy, a financial services analyst at Oppenheimer & Co., says interest rates will be the predictor of future growth and stability of the banking industry. McEvoy talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Shorrock Says `Intelligence Should Not Be Privatized' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Shorrock Says Intelligence Should Not Be Privatized
item.itunes:summary: June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Tim Shorrock, author of "Spies for Hire," says intelligence work should not be contracted to private companies because of the potential for governmental corruption. Shorrock talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SocGen's Juckes Says Volatility `Signals Capitulation' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Juckes Says Volatility `Signals Capitulation'
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Kit Juckes, global strategist at Societe Generale in London, says market volatility is due to capitulation from countries in Europe and Asia. Juckes talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CFR's Haass Says Snowden in Moscow `a Real Setback' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: CFR's Haass Says Snowden in Moscow `a Real Setback'
item.itunes:summary:
June 24 (Bloomberg) -- Richard Haass, president of the U.S. Council on Foreign Relations, says Hong Kong allowing Edward Snowden to leave and Russia allowing him to enter the country has damaged U.S. relations with the two countries. Snowden's disclosure of U.S. electronic surveillance operations led to his being charged with espionage. Haass talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Deutsche Bank's Hooper Sees 'Momentum in the Markets' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Deutsche Bank's Hooper Sees Momentum in the Markets
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Hooper, chief economist of Deutsche Bank Securities, sees momentum in the markets. Hooper talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Big Picture's Ritholtz Says `Market Will Recover' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Big Picture's Ritholtz Says `Market Will Recover'
item.itunes:summary: June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Barry Ritholtz, chief executive officer and director of research at Fusioniq, says the market will recover as investors move away from bullish expectations. Ritholtz talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BlackRock's Rieder Says Fed Slowdown `Data-Dependent' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Rieder Says Fed Slowdown `Data-Dependent'
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Rick Rieder, chief investment officer for fundamental fixed income at BlackRock Inc., says the Federal Reserve has vowed to only taper its asset purchasing if financial data supports it. Rieder talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wolfe Trahan's Keay Says Emerging Markets Buying Planes (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Keay Says Emerging Markets Buying Planes
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Hunter Keay, analyst at Wolfe Trahan & Co., says airlines in emerging markets are responsible for most new planes being bought today. He says U.S. airlines are more focused on refurbishing their current fleets. Keay talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Burson's Gershkoff Says New Analytics `Optimized' Ads (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Gershkoff Says New Analytics `Optimized' Ads
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Amy Gershkoff, director of global analytics at Burson-Marsteller LLC, says new data collection techniques developed during political campaigns are being used to more accurately direct advertisements toward the right audience. Gershkoff talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Lombard Street's Beamish Sees 'Slower Growth in China' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Beamish Sees 'Slower Growth in China'
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Freya Beamish, an economist at Lombard Street Research, discusses slower growth rates in China and the Chinese government's push toward economic reform. Beamish talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Holland Says Market Will Improve Despite QE Concern (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Holland Says Market Will Improve Despite QE Concern
item.itunes:summary: June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Holland, chairman and founder of Holland & Co., says the market will improve despite a backlash to the Federal Reserve's timetable on quantitative easing. Holland talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene, Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Johnny Rockets's Devine Says International Business Big (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Devine Says Rockets' International Business Big
item.itunes:summary:
June 21 (Bloomberg) -- Steve Devine, president of Johnny Rockets International Inc., discusses Johnny Rockets's operations and its success domestically and internationally. Devine talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Consultant Lykken Sees `End’ of Low Rate Cycle (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Consultant Lykken Sees `End’ of Low Rate Cycle
item.itunes:summary: June 20 (Bloomberg) -- David Lykken, managing partner of the Austin, Texas-based consulting firm, Mortgage Banking Solutions, says mortgage rates may have already hit bottom. Lykken talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Airline Passenger's Kirby Says Gogo IPO Going Well (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Airline Passenger's Kirby Says Gogo IPO Going Well
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Mary Kirby, editor in chief of Airline Passenger Experience magazine, says Gogo Inc.'s initial public offering went well, as the company captures a large share of the United States in-flight connectivity market. Kirby talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pimco’s Gross Says Fed Dismissive of Mortgage Impact (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Gross Says Fed Dismissive of Mortgage Impact
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Bill Gross, manager of the world's biggest mutual fund, Pacific Investment Management Company, says the Federal Reserve's forecast of increased economic activity is dismissive of an increase in home mortgage interest rates. Gross talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: FTN’s Low Says U.S. Treasuries Shed Haven Status (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: FTN’s Low Says U.S. Treasuries Shed Haven Status
item.itunes:summary: June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Christopher Low, chief economist at FTN Financial in New York, says the rise in U.S. Treasury yields and the corresponding decline in prices means investors are "searching for a new safe haven." Low talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Levitt Says Tougher Prosecution by SEC Is `Smart Move’ (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Levitt Says Tougher Prosecution by SEC Is 'Smart'
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Arthur Levitt, former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, says the SEC's plan to seek guilty pleas and "make an example" of some companies is "the right move." Levitt talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Smead Says Stimulus Failed to Create Wealth in China (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Smead Says Stimulus Fails to Create Wealth in China
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- William Smead, chief investment officer at Smead Capital Management, says stimulus programs in China boosted gross domestic product, "but didn't create any wealth." Smead talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pioneer’s Upadhyaya Says Fed Unnerved Emerging Markets (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Upadhyaya Says Fed Unnerved Emerging Markets
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Paresh Upadhyaya, director of currency strategy at Pioneer Investment Management Co., says the central banks of emerging market nations have to intervene to keep their currencies from falling after a more hawkish tone from the Federal Reserve. Upadhyaya talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bloomberg's Hayzlett Says `Apple Is Still First' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Bloomberg's Hayzlett Says `Apple Is Still First'
item.itunes:summary: June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Former Eastman Kodak Co. Chief Marketing Officer Jeffrey Hayzlett, a Bloomberg Television contributing editor, says Apple is still the best branded technology company. Hayzlett talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UBS’s Drew Matus Says `No One’ Believes Fed Target (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: UBS’s Drew Matus Says `No One’ Believes Fed Target
item.itunes:summary:
June 20 (Bloomberg) -- Drew Matus, a former economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York and now an economist at UBS AG in Stamford, Connecticut, says when the Fed announces a target for policy action "there is always some way around it." Matus talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sri-Kumar Says 'Fed not Delivering' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sri-Kumar Says 'Fed not Delivering'
item.itunes:summary: May 1 (Bloomberg) -- Komal Sri-Kumar, founder of Sri-Kumar Global Strategies Inc., says the U.S. is in a "lukewarm" economic recovery. Sri Kumar talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SocGen’s Galy Says Euro Has Room to Strengthen (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: SocGen’s Galy Says Euro Has Room to Strengthen
item.itunes:summary:
June 19 (Bloomberg) -- Sebastien Galy, a senior foreign-exchange strategist at Societe Generale SA, says a $1.35 euro is quite reachable. Galy talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: TD Bank’s Braca Says Rates and Profits Will Come Back (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Braca Says Rates and Profits Will Come Back
item.itunes:summary: June 19 (Bloomberg) -- Greg Braca, head of U.S. corporate and specialty banking at Toronto-Dominion Bank, says the business of taking in deposits and lending out money has become "a lot less profitable." Braca talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Triton’s Wallace Explains Changing Research (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Triton’s Wallace Explains Changing Research
item.itunes:summary: June 19 (Bloomberg) -- Rett Wallace, co-founder of Triton Research, says independent company research is more essential with an increase of initial public offerings. Wallace talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rudin Says NYC Real Estate Changing in `Positive Way’ (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Rudin Says NYC Real Estate Changing in Positive Way
item.itunes:summary: June 19 (Bloomberg) -- William Rudin, chief executive officer of Rudin Management Co., says New York City is seeing "urbanization" especially among young people. Rudin talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oppenheimer’s Stoltzfus Likes Technology, Materials (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Oppenheimer’s Stoltzfus Likes Technology, Materials
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- John Stoltzfus, chief equity strategist at Oppenheimer & Co., says materials stocks and consumer technology stocks represent buying opportunities. Stoltzfus talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mitsubishi’s Herrmann Sees Robust Hiring in U.S. (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Mitsubishi’s Herrmann Sees Robust Hiring in U.S.
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- John Herrmann, director of U.S. rate strategy at Mitsubishi UFJ Securities USA Inc., says spring job creation was among the "top ten" in the past 30 years. Herrmann talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UC’s DeLong Says Income Gap in U.S. Is Getting Wider (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: DeLong Says Income Gap in U.S. Is Getting Wider
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Bradford DeLong, a professor at the University of California at Berkeley, says the U.S. standard of living is rising only at the top end of incomes. DeLong talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Yale’s Roach Sees Addiction to Fed’s Easy Money (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Yale’s Roach Sees Addiction to Fed’s Easy Money
item.itunes:summary: June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Roach, a senior fellow at Yale University and former non-executive chairman for Morgan Stanley in Asia, says Federal Reserve policy has created "an addiction" to "easy money." Roach talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene, Scarlet Fu and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Marc Chandler Says Emerging Markets Under Pressure (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Marc Chandler Says Emerging Markets Under Pressure
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Marc Chandler, global head of currency strategy at Brown Brothers Harriman & Co., says emerging market currencies are "still under pressure" because of concerns over possible Federal Reserve tapering. Chandler talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Qorvis’s Collender Says Federal Deficit `Small Number’ (Audio
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Collender Says Federal Deficit a `Small Number'
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Stan Collender, a former Democratic Congressional budget analyst and now a partner at Qorvis Communications LLC, says sequestration has reduced the federal deficit to a relatively small portion of the overall economy. Collender talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CBBI’s Miller Says China GDP Is `Just an Approximation’ (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Miller Says China GDP Is `Just an Approximation'
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) - Leland Miller, president of China Beige Book International, says gross domestic product is "not the best indicator" of economic growth in China. Miller talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." They are joined by Stephen Roach of yale University.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bellafare's O'Shaughnessy Says Wedding Budgets `Double' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: O'Shaughnessy Says Wedding Budgets `Double'
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Lauren O'Shaughnessy, co-founder of Bellafare, a wedding planning company, says the cost of weddings, especially in New York City, has been getting significantly higher since 2009. O'Shaughnessy talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Jefferies's Volkmann Says World `Reasonably Mined' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Jefferies's Volkmann Says World `Reasonably Mined'
item.itunes:summary:
June 18 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Volkmann, managing director at Jefferies Group LLC, says Caterpillar Inc.'s stock woes can be attributed to a lack of necessity for equipment in the mining industry. Volkmann talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Unicredit’s Nielsen Says Growth in Site for Periphery (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Nielsen Says Growth in Site for Periphery
item.itunes:summary: June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Erik Nielsen, global chief economist at UniCredit Bank AG, says "most of peripheral Europe" will have economic growth a year from now. Nielsen talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dartmouth's Blanchflower Says Nobel Winner `Practical' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Blanchflower Says Nobel Winner `Practical'
item.itunes:summary: June 17 (Bloomberg) -- David Blanchflower, professor of economics at Dartmouth College, says newly knighted Nobel Prize winner for economics Christopher Pissarides deserved the honor for his work on unemployment issues. Blanchflower talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nile Capital's Seruma Sees Low Risk in Frontier Markets (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Seruma Sees Low Risk in Frontier Markets
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Larry Seruma, chief investment officer and managing principal at Nile Capital Management, says frontier markets such as Nigeria and Ghana carry a higher return with lower risk than many emerging markets. Seruma talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Levitt Says SEC Money Market Plan to `Scare Investors' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Levitt Says Money Market Plan to `Scare Investors'
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Arthur Levitt, former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, says the SEC's plan to regulate money market funds will see investors "rush to the doors." Levitt talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sterne, Agee's Karasyov Says Cable TV Dominating (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sterne, Agee's Karasyov Says Cable TV Dominating
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Vasily Karasyov, analyst at Sterne, Agee & Leach Inc., says cable television will remain dominant over the publishing industry. Karasyov talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cromwell’s Cohen Says Fed Preventing Big Bank Mergers (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Cohen Says Fed Preventing Big Bank Mergers
item.itunes:summary: June 17 (Bloomberg) -- H. Rodgin Cohen, a lawyer who has represented big banks as senior chairman at Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, says Federal Reserve policy is "hindering" bank mergers. Cohen talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Univ. of Texas’s Galbraith Sees `No Hope’ for Greece (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Galbraith Sees `No Hope’ for Greece
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- James Galbraith, an economics professor at the University of Texas, says Greece is in "a very deep depression." Galbraith talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: George Mason’s Cronin Questions Effectiveness of Drones (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Cronin Questions Effectiveness of Drones
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Audrey Cronin, a professor at George Mason University, says drones are not helping to defeat terrorism. Cronin talks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu, Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Harvard’s George Says Data Surveillance `Vital’ Issue (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: George Says Data Surveillance `Vital’ Issue
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Bill George, a professor at Harvard Business School, says government surveillance of data will be an "increasingly large issue" for companies like Apple and Google. George talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene, Scarlet Fu and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Gamco’s Howard Ward Says He Remains Bullish on Stocks (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Howard Ward Says He Remains Bullish on Stocks
item.itunes:summary:
June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Howard Ward, chief investment officer at Gamco Investors Inc., says "there is a lot of good news out there" from corporate earnings to economic data. Ward talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Westpac’s Franulovich Says Fed to `Push Back’ on Taper (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Franulovich Says Fed to `Push Back’ on Taper
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Richard Franulovich, a senior currency strategist at Westpac Banking Corp., says next week Federal Reserve officials will probably indicate they are not about to ease their program of asset purchases. Franulovich talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BlackRock’s Shen `Quite Positive on Brazil’ (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BlackRock’s Shen `Quite Positive on Brazil’
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Jeffrey Shen, head of emerging markets at BlackRock Inc., the world's largest asset manager, says there are many positive long-term trends for stocks in Brazil. Shen talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fannie’s Duncan Says U.S. Home Price Rise Will Continue (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Duncan Says U.S. Home Price Rise Will Continue
item.itunes:summary: June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Doug Duncan, chief economist at Washington-based Fannie Mae, says home prices will rise 7 percent in the next 12 months. Duncan talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Janney Montgomery's Strasser Says Retail Mood Hopeful (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Strasser Says Retail Mood Hopeful
item.itunes:summary: June 14 (Bloomberg) -- David Strasser, managing director at Janney Montgomery Scott LLC, says the mood in retail sales is "one of hope." Strasser talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: George Gilder Says Information Trumping Economics (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: George Gilder Says Information Trumping Economics
item.itunes:summary: June 14 (Bloomberg) -- George Gilder, chairman and founder of Gilder Technology Group, says that new information technology has overridden classical theories of economics. Gilder talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kroll’s Karson Says U.S. Knows Exactly Where Snowden Is (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Karson Says U.S. Knows Exactly Where Snowden Is
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Daniel Karson, a chairman with Kroll Advisory Solutions in New York, says Edward Snowden, the technology contractor who leaked details about classified U.S. spy programs, cannot hide for very long from U.S. authorities. Karson talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Scarlet Fu on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Vevo CEO Rio Caraeff `Believes in Partnering’ (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Vevo CEO Rio Caraeff `Believes in Partnering’
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Rio Caraeff, president and chief executive officer of Vevo LLC, which distributes music videos and entertainment services through its website, says "you get further, faster by parternering" with other businesses. Caraeff talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Analyst Craig Moffett Says Pay TV Is Under Pressure (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Analyst Craig Moffett Says Pay TV Is Under Pressure
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Craig Moffett, an analyst at Moffett Research LLC, says "you are starting to see TV subscribership decline." Moffett talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Scarlet Fu on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Renaissance’s Dutta `Fairly Cautious’ on Emerging Mkts (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Dutta `Fairly Cautious’ on Emerging Markets
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Neil Dutta, head U.S. economist at Renaissance Macro Research LLC, says emerging market economies are "bumping up against their structural growth limitations." Dutta talks with Bloomberg's Bob Moon on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg The First Word."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: A Closer Look With Arthur Levitt: Paul Begala (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: A Closer Look With Arthur Levitt: Paul Begala
item.itunes:summary:
June 14 (Bloomberg) -- Arthur Levitt, former chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, interviews Democratic communications strategist Paul Begala. Begala is a professor at Georgetown University, a TV commentator and a former adviser to President Bill Clinton. They spoke on Bloomberg Radio's "A Closer Look With Arthur Levitt."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UBS’s Matus Says Jobless Rate to Fall for Right Reasons (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Matus Says Jobless Rate to Fall for Right Reasons
item.itunes:summary: June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Drew Matus, senior U.S. economist at UBS Securities, says the unemployment rate will fall and the participation rate will also decline as more older people feel more secure and work less. Matus talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rabobank’s Foley Says `Risk Appetite’ to Improve (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Rabobank’s Foley Says `Risk Appetite’ to Improve
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Jane Foley, senior currency strategist at Rabobank International, says Federal Reserve "easy as it goes" policy will encourage more risk-taking this summer. Foley talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Levitt Says Texas Legislators Oppose Immigration Bill (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Levitt Says Texas Senators Oppose Immigration Bill
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Arthur Levitt, former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, says the opposition of Republican Texas senators to an immigration bill, S. 744, may have an adverse effect on the future of their party. Levitt talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and guest host Drew Matus of UBS Securities on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Gartman Letter's Gartman Says More To Enter Retirement (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Gartman Says More Will Enter Retirement
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Dennis Gartman, editor of the Gartman Letter, says that recently financially stable older workers can now retire and will make room for younger people to enter the job market. Gartman talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and guest host Drew Matus of UBS Securities on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SHFL CEO Isaacs Says Gambling in Asia Is `Booming' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: SHFL CEO Isaacs Says Gambling in Asia Is `Booming'
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Gavin Isaacs, chief executive officer at SHFL Entertainment Inc., says while the U.S gambling market is still recovering, Asian countries, Macau especially, have embraced casinos. Isaacs talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: FTN’s Low `Not Worried at All’ About Housing Bubble (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: FTN’s Low `Not Worried at All’ About Housing Bubble
item.itunes:summary: June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Christopher Low, chief economist at FTN Financial in New York, says the rise in home prices can be sustained for another five years without worries of a "bubble." Low talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Renaissance’s Dutta Says `Doesn’t Take Much’ for 3% GDP (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Dutta Says `Doesn’t Take Much’ for 3% GDP
item.itunes:summary: June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Neil Dutta, head U.S. economist at Renaissance Macro Research LLC, says U.S. economic growth will be 3 to 3.5 percent by year end. Dutta talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: FTN’s Low `Not at Worried at All’ About Housing Bubble (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Low `Not at Worried at All’ About Housing Bubble
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Christopher Low, chief economist at FTN Financial in New York, says the rise in home prices can be sustained for another five years without worries of a "bubble." Low talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nomura’s Kurtz Sees Value in South Korea, Taiwan (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Nomura’s Kurtz Sees Value in South Korea, Taiwan, 6/13
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Kurtz, global head of equity strategy at Nomura Holdings Inc. in Hong Kong, says there is more value and "robust earnings" in South Korea and Taiwan. Kurtz talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Author Auletta Calls Extent of Surveillance a Mystery (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Auletta Calls Extent of Surveillance a Mystery
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Ken Auletta, author and New Yorker writer, says the public has yet to find out the extent of government surveillance on them. Auletta talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene, Scarlet Fu and Alix Steele on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Falkenrath Says Reaction to Internet Surveillance Muted (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Falkenrath Says Reaction to Surveillance Muted
item.itunes:summary:
June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Richard Falkenrath, a principal at the Chertoff Group and a Bloomberg Television contributing editor, says public reaction to government Internet surveillance has been "muted." Falkenrath talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Scarlet Fu on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pioneer Investment's Feltus Advises on Emerging Markets (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Feltus Advises on Emerging Markets
item.itunes:summary: June 12 (Bloomberg) -- Andrew Feltus, fund manager at Pioneer Investment Management, says there are opportunities in today's emerging markets through the purchase of bonds and currencies. Feltus talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Joe Brusuelas on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: MKM's Michael Darda Says Emerging Markets `Cyclical' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael Darda Says Emerging Markets `Cyclical'
item.itunes:summary: June 12 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Darda, chief economist at MKM Partners LLC, says emerging markets are moving in cyclical pattern. Darda talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Joe Brusuelas on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Nomura's McCormack Says SoftBank Ahead in Sprint Deal (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: McCormack Says SoftBank Ahead in Sprint Deal
item.itunes:summary: June 12 (Bloomberg) -- Michael McCormack, senior analyst at Nomura Holdings Inc., says SoftBank Corp. "has a slightly upper hand" in the pursuit of the acquisition of Sprint Nextel Corp. McCormack talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Joe Brusuelas on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ravi Venkatesan Says Indian Economy `Slow, Corrupt' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Ravi Venkatesan Says Indian Economy `Slow, Corrupt'
item.itunes:summary: June 12 (Bloomberg) -- Ravi Venkatesan, former chairman of Microsoft India, says the Indian economy is in a dire struggle but that there is value in other emerging markets. Venkatesan talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Joe Brusuelas on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: TiVo CEO Thomas Rogers Says Company `Well Beyond’ DVRs (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: TiVo CEO Rogers Says Company `Well Beyond’ DVRs
item.itunes:summary:
June 12 (Bloomberg) -- Thomas Rogers, chief executive officer of TiVo Inc., says "streaming and on demand" are core to the company. Rogers talks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene and Sara Eisen on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(Source: Bloomberg)
